Index: =================================================================== --- +++ @@ -52,47 +52,897 @@
-
-
-

- -

-
-
- This is the first item's accordion body. It is shown by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the .accordion-body, though the transition does limit overflow. -
-
+
+

Bestiary

+
+

Explore the diverse creatures of Dungeons & Dragons in our comprehensive Bestiary. From iconic to obscure, uncover their lore, strengths, and weaknesses.

+

Click below to dive into the lore of each creature!

+
+
+ + + + + + + A + +
+ +
+
+ + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + + +
-
-

- -

-
-
- This is the second item's accordion body. It is hidden by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the .accordion-body, though the transition does limit overflow. -
-

- This is the third item's accordion body. It is hidden by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the .accordion-body, though the transition does limit overflow. -

Index: =================================================================== --- +++ @@ -3,9 +3,9 @@ - Bestiary + Player Races @@ -53,11 +53,11 @@
-

Bestiary

+

Player Races

-

Explore the diverse creatures of Dungeons & Dragons in our comprehensive Bestiary. From iconic to obscure, uncover their lore, strengths, and weaknesses.

+

Explore the diverse races of Dungeons & Dragons in our comprehensive compendium. Uncover their unique cultures, abilities, and histories. Whether you're a seasoned adventurer or a curious newcomer, our compendium is your portal to a world of extraordinary beings and boundless adventures.

Click below to dive into the lore of each creature!

Player Races

+
+

Explore the diverse races of Dungeons & Dragons in our comprehensive compendium. Uncover their unique cultures, abilities, and histories. Whether you're a seasoned adventurer or a curious newcomer, our compendium is your portal to a world of extraordinary beings and boundless adventures.

+

Click on the links below to delve into the lore of each race and craft your own fantasy tale!

Player Races

+
+

Explore the diverse races of Dungeons & Dragons in our comprehensive compendium. Uncover their unique cultures, abilities, and histories. Whether you're a seasoned adventurer or a curious newcomer, our compendium is your portal to a world of extraordinary beings and boundless adventures.

+

Click on the links below to delve into the lore of each race and craft your own fantasy tale!

commits.name: Commit-0
commits.content:
D&D Resource
  • Player Resources
    Races Classes
    Bestiary
  • Player Tools
    Character Sheet Dice Roll Generator
    More

This is the first item's accordion body. It is shown by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the .accordion-body, though the transition does limit overflow.

This is the second item's accordion body. It is hidden by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the .accordion-body, though the transition does limit overflow.

This is the third item's accordion body. It is hidden by default, until the collapse plugin adds the appropriate classes that we use to style each element. These classes control the overall appearance, as well as the showing and hiding via CSS transitions. You can modify any of this with custom CSS or overriding our default variables. It's also worth noting that just about any HTML can go within the .accordion-body, though the transition does limit overflow.

© Chad Oswald | chadloswald@gmail.com
